medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe pain over the right anterior chest described as a 'hardache.'
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began a little over 3 weeks prior while reaching over to pick something off the floor of her car when she 'heard a click and developed a sharp pain.' There were episodes of similar pain over the past 7 months, usually localized to one area of the chest and lasting several days. The current pain was pleuritic, exacerbated by movement, and would wax and wane but never resolved completely.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Graves' disease (after radioablation), basal cell carcinoma of the face, renal lithiasis, and 30-lb unintentional weight loss over the last year. Allergic to penicillin; only medication is levothyroxine. Surgical history includes excision of basal cell carcinoma and vaginal polypectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at age 46 of 'cancer of the spine'; mother died at age 83 of gynecologic cancer.
medical_history.social_history: 30 pack-year tobacco habit (quit 26 years ago); denied ethanol or illicit drug use. Lives alone, unmarried, no children. Worked as a machine operator and ceramic employee.
